subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Automatic reply: Quick reply
description:
Additional To: jimmcq@bungie.com
CC: tnelson@bungie.com; a-mvanwell@bungie.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Automatic reply: Quick reply
Body:
Hi Jim,

Thanks for you reply. We offer end-end order management and fraud
prevention through our Shopify app.

Effectively, every order created in your checkout would be initially
authorized and then instantly reviewed and dispositioned with a binary
good/bad indication. Signifyd then forces capture and fulfills only legit
orders into SendOwl, while fraudulent orders remain on hold in Shopify's
order grid. Every order approved by Signifyd is also financially backed
with 100% Chargeback Reimbursement.

This would provide a totally hands off approach to fraud and order
management so that your resources can be focused primarily on creative
marketing and design.

I'd be happy to talk through this is more detail next week. When are you or
your team free to connect?

Subject: Ecommerce Protection for Beach Bunny Swimwear
Body:
Hi Katie,

Realize you work on e-commerce and want to connect and see if you have
fraud issues at Beach Bunny Swimwear.  We work with many companies like you
to help get in front of CNP fraud issues.  Our service essentially screens
your e-commerce transactions for fraud and acts as an insurance company for
you as well - by reimbursing you for any chargebacks you incur on orders we
say are good.  This all happens in a fraction of second so it won't disturb
your customer experience.

Wayfair is a great example of a client we help protect:
*https://www.signifyd.com/customers/wayfair/
<https://www.signifyd.com/customers/wayfair/>*

Would you have time to discuss if fraud's been an issue for you?
Alternatively, I can send over a quick one-sheet to review.

Ali

> 
> Hi Ali,
> 
> Thanks for the kind words. about 50% of our orders are Amazon Pay and PayPal and they offer fraud protection. The rest of the orders go through a fraud filter and we cancel the ones that are high risk. We get hit from time to time but the cost of those do not amount to the commission companies may take from our sales. Thanks again for reaching out and have a great day!
> 
> Kind Regards,

> Bombshell Sportswear

> 
> I will forward your information to our relevant team. Have a happy and healthy day!
> 
> Regards,
> Reese
> 
>             	
> Ali Smith
> Jul 11, 12:35 PDT
> 
> Hi Dominque and Christian,
> 
> Realize I've reached out to you both in the past to connect. I'm a fan of your brand and have a couple of pairs of the leggings and love them.
> 
> Because you do a fair amount of social media advertising, I'm sure you guys are targeted by the e-commerce fraud that's pretty common nowadays. We offer a simple insurance against chargebacks via our app in Shopify: https://apps.shopify.com/signifyd
> 
> Orders are reviewed automatically by our app and as long as they are guaranteed, we assume financial responsibility for any chargebacks you receive. We also act as a managed service of sorts for your e-commerce order review and you'll have access to our team of fraud analysts that will make phone calls on your behalf to secure copies of credit cards or ID's to verify identity.
> 
> It's likely that you guys are a smaller shop and are careful with how you spend your time and money and we'd love to help. Check out the app and let me know if you're open to a quick call!
> 
> Ali

subject: Unresolved Email: Signifyd E-commerce Fraud Protection Follow Up
description:
Additional To: arlene@airportappliance.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: Signifyd One Sheet.pdf, Signifyd Forrester TEI Study.pdf

Subject: Signifyd E-commerce Fraud Protection Follow Up
Body:
Hi Arlene,

Great to speak with you on the phone yesterday!  It was cool to connect
with Airport Home Appliance again, after working with Kris on voice over
and commercials when I used to work at Pandora.

To follow up on our conversation:

   - Signifyd protects your e-commerce purchases from fraud by reviewing
   your transactions for indicators of fraud.  We work with over 5,000
   merchants (people like Jet.com
   <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rcutxenpufs>, Build.com
   <https://www.signifyd.com/customers/build/> and Wayfair.com
   <https://www.signifyd.com/customers/wayfair/>) to reduce your time spent
   in manual order review, increase your order acceptance rates and protect
   you from the financial chargeback liability on fraudulent orders.  We
   combine the information from all of our current clients with multiple third
   party data sources to make these decisions; all within a matter of
   seconds.  For orders we don't decide automatically, our team of in-house
   fraud analysts will look at the orders to make a final call.
   - Overall, this should improve Airport Home Appliance's overall time
   spent reviewing your e-commerce orders and and get product shipped more
   quickly to your customers.

I've attached our one-sheet that gives an overview of the system and a case
study from Forrester that shares more about the return on investment on the
service.

*As a next step, would it make sense to have a call where I can demo the
dashboard and show you what this would look like on a good or bad
transaction?  *That should illustrate how we make the decisions.  If you
have a technical person that works on the website, that might be a good
person to bring in as well.

Ali

-- 
*Ali Smith*
Account Executive

*SIGNIFYD*
650-352-3779
www.signifyd.com <http://go.toutapp.com/fee2814d7054e0735f>

Check out our 5 STAR REVIEWS on Shopify
<http://go.toutapp.com/7323648acfc06c5e1c> and Magento
<http://go.toutapp.com/f870b76ff0d0c0dafc>

description:

BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Madison Avenue Couture: Yixin Zhang #3002
Body:
Hello Wonmi ,

I took a look at the notes. The card holder did not provide her address. If
she was ordering for her friend she should be able to provide her own
information like billing address. Also, we cannot tie her to the phone
number or email address provided. So these are additional reasons why we
cannot approve this order and take on the risk.

If she can provide you something of hers that has her address that you can
upload along with a phone number that ties to her you can try to resubmit.
I hope this helps.

Sincerely,

*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

Subject: Re: Signifyd intro
Body:
That's not the way we do business. I can't just rely on the answers you
give me without verifying the data.

I understand NoFraud may operate like that as they're notorious for handing
out unjustifiable pricing rates. You have to understand they're the
youngest and smallest vendor in this space so they're in the phase of
buying business to get funding. We're the oldest and largest with the most
funding already so it's more important for us to make wiser investments.

If all you want is lower pricing you might be better off just asking them
for it. We charge a premium in our space because we provide value in other
places such as revenue growth.

Again, I'm happy to talk over the phone but I won't race to the lowest
price if that's all your interested in.

frantically scrambling to catch their flight to Miami for the Christmas
holiday? Not to mention they left Kevin at home... alone!

Unfortunately, 'manual' fraud detection for online retailers over the
holidays is a lot like the McCallister's: scrambling last minute. With our
Guaranteed Fraud Protection, Some of our customers have increased their
revenue by as much as *4%*.

anything more.

Hard to believe? I've linked the Forrester case study here
<http://go.toutapp.com/6e1dcccbedead83f23>.

Would it be worth 15 minutes next Thursday or Friday to see how much of a

Additional To: jessi.jass@boardriders.com
CC: monique.deblase@boardriders.com
BCC: 
Attachment: image001.png

Subject: Re: New User Request for Signifyd
Body:
Hello Jessi,

I can certainly add Monique to the Signifyd Console. What type of access
would you like me to grant her? Here are the roles available.


User Roles

*Owner*

An owner has full rights and privileges within the SIGNIFYD merchant
account. The user who sets up the merchant account is labelled owner by
default. (In other words, upon creation of a SIGNIFYD merchant account, the
user will automatically be added to the merchant account as the owner.)
Once an owner has created a merchant account, they may add new users and
specify the level of access for each one.

*Admin*

An admin has all the same privileges as an owner with the exception of
changing status to Owner.

*Member*

A member has all the same privileges as an owner and an admin with the
exception of inviting and deleting users to SIGNIFYD and viewing the
billing section. Members are also not able to change the status of other
users.

Monique - Nice to virtually meet you. Once I set you up with Console access
and you have had a chance to log in, I am happy to set up a call to give
you an overview of the Signifyd Console.

Sincerely,


*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

subject: Fruad Alert
description:
Hi Sarah,

I came across your profile on LinkedIn the other day and ended up doing quite a bit of research on Eileen Fisher.
I was trying to find out… Did you guys had issues with chargebacks or decline rates last holiday season and would you like to prevent that this year?
I’m asking because this time of year fraudsters like to mask themselves in all of the holiday noise. From what I’ve seen from meeting with executives in your industry chargebacks and decline rates have been a real pain.
If you're like most you could possibly see a 4% increase in revenue selling nothing further.
Is this something worth looking into now or after the holiday season?


Dustin

subject: Your Holiday Performance Review
description:
Hi Laura,

I thought it might be worth you're while to meet up mid-January (After the holiday madness) to see how you stacked up amongst your peers in the same size and industry. 

- Did you see more declined orders than everyone else?
- Did you see more chargebacks than everyone else?
- How much revenue did you lose/gain compared to others?

Meeting daily with executives in your industry has allowed us to compile this valuable information.  Are you interested to hear how your company performed compared to others?

Just reply with a day and time in January and I'll shoot over a calendar invite. We can fine tune as it gets closer if need be.

Cheers,


Dustin

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Case Review Please
description:
Additional To: satisfaction@pmctire.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Case Review Please
Body:
Hi Katherine,

After the second review we discovered a handful of things that were not
found on the first order:

   - Same BIN was used on previous order under IP history w/ different CH
   name:
   https://admin.signifyd.com/casesearch?offset=0&limit=50&status=ALL&similarityInvestigationId=489994098&similarityAttributes=SIM_IP_ADDRESS
   - Alternate email (alindemian@yopmail.com) is only 62 days old
   - Email domain (yopmail) appears to be a disposable domain

To compound issues the IP used for the order is associated to a hosting
service and the billing address for the order was unreliable due to an AVS
failure

At this point, we'd recommend for the customer to provide us with
identification to tie to the billing address.

Let me know your thoughts when you have a chance to review.

Best,
Ike

checkout. This leads me to believe you are trying to eliminate fraud the
best you can.

15-minute conversation next month after the holiday rush?

markets and add guest checkout resulting in more revenue.

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Signifyd Policy - SunBriteTV
description:
Additional To: jonathan.johnson@sunbritetv.com
CC: amanda.dalesandry@sunbritetv.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Signifyd Policy - SunBriteTV
Body:
Hey Jonathan,

Going forward, I'd recommend having a member of SunBrite writing into
Signifyd Support for context as to why an order was declined. If an order
is declined due to something address related, if you could ask the customer
to provide proof/context to their ties to the address it would be
appreciated. Normally this proof would be:

   - ID
   - Copy of Credit Card
   - LinkedIn profile link (if shipping address is business)
   - Social media ties

If there's ever a situation that needs immediate examination feel free to
reach out to me directly at ike.ogamba@signifyd.com.

Thanks,
Ike



Powered by Gmelius <https://gmelius.com?ref=mail>

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Signifyd Policy - SunBriteTV
description:
Additional To: jonathan.johnson@sunbritetv.com
CC: amanda.dalesandry@sunbritetv.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Signifyd Policy - SunBriteTV
Body:
Jonathan,

Unfortunately, we're unable to accommodate that request. However there is
another measure that we could do to meet in the middle. If you believe
we’ve made an error in our decision to decline an order, you have the
option of resubmitting the order and we’ll review it again.

Common reasons to resubmit an order for Guarantee:

   - There was insufficient information present for us to provide an
   approve decision.
   - You have additional information about the order you would like us to
   consider.

Resubmitting an order puts the order in a pending status and moves it into
the hands of a fraud analyst to review. These analysts have a large number
of tools and resources at their disposal and have the ability to reason,
unlike a model.

Our fraud analysts add notes and details regarding each decision they make.

How to Resubmit an Order for Guarantee

1. Select the order you want to resubmit from within the console. From the
order page, click the Re-Submit Guarantee Request button from the action
menu.

2. In the dialog box that appears, please provide us with as much
information as possible as to why you’d like us to re-review this order,
including any or all of the following:

– Comments about past order history

– Additional notes based upon your own investigation as to why we should
take a second look

3. Finally, click Submit. After submitting, the guarantee status will
change to Re-Reviewing and will be sent to our team for review. We will
provide an approve or decline decision on the order within 24 hours.

Let me know your thoughts once you have a chance to review.

Best,
Ike



Powered by Gmelius <https://gmelius.com?ref=mail>

subject: Dustin Mena Meeting
description:
Hi David,

My name is Dustin Mena, I currently am in the early phases of starting a for-profit company with a mandate of seeing social injustices eradicated around the world.

Our vision is to create retail items (backpacks, accessories, clothing) that have a cause attached to them. For example; insulated water bottles would be attached to clean water initiatives. Our heart is to bring greater awareness to non-profits as well as financially partner with them.

I noticed you and I are both in the Redding area. Are you available to connect once the busyness of the holidays settles down?

All the best,

Dustin


Dustin

Subject: Power Plus Cases | Signifyd
Body:
Hello,

After a review of Power Plus Cases' account, our records indicate that
Signifyd is carrying a $72.54 balance in past due accounts receivable for
our fraud prevention services for http://powerpluscases.com. Although we
have sent you notices of this past due amount however we have not received
any payment [or response].

Please contact us immediately at billing@signifyd.com to resolve the
balance on your account. If payment is not received by 1/3/2018, within 15
days of this notice, we will be forced to suspend or terminate your access
to your Signifyd account and your use of our fraud prevention services for
http://powerpluscases.com.

Please note that, depending on your integration with Signifyd, this may
disrupt your order processing and fulfillment. Your webmaster can answer
any questions regarding your integration with Signifyd.

If you have already sent us your payment, please confirm with
billing@signifyd.com when we can expect to receive the payment. Thank you
very much for your attention to this matter and your continued business.

Kind Regards

Billing Department

-- 
Ike Ogamba
Client Services Manager | Signifyd

Body:
Hi Lenny,

I hope you had a fantastic holiday season both personally and
professionally. I wanted to reach out and see if it 's worth 20 minutes for
us to chat in the coming weeks.

Are you curious to know how Books-A-Million performed compared to your
peers in similar size and industry, this past holiday season? We have that
info and I'd be happy to share.

One last note, I don't see anything on your website under "shipping" that
mentions shipping internationally... If you gave us all your "risky" orders
that normally wouldn't be approved and it resulted in more revenue for you
would it be worth opening new markets?

the results they are seeing.

description:
Additional To: alexandra@endy.com; cole.spear@signifyd.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Declined Reimbursement
Body:
Hello Alexandra,

Thank you for taking my call earlier. Below are notes from that call.

*Topics Discussed:*

*Change to Terms of Service **Email Notification**-  *We discussed that the
notification was sent to Mike Gettis in July by our system automation. This
was not seen by you. Going forward we will make sure you get any and all
notifications that come from either me or Signifyd automation. I have
talked to the team about this chargeback and we will go ahead and process
it. Going forward please do submit chargebacks per our Terms of Service.
<https://www.signifyd.com/terms/>

*Monthly Report- *I had the report ran after our call. Please let me know
if you see it in your inbox.

*Billing - *I apologize for the delay in sending your invoice this month.
We are a bit behind but plan to have it to you by end of day Monday.

On Sun, Jan 7, 2018 at 7:07 AM, Alexandra Voyevodina <alexandra@endy.com>
wrote:

> Thanks Raul!
> I have noticed an increase in declined cases again and most of them are
> clearly not fraudulent. If we have to manually request to have as many as
> 10% of our orders re-reviewed we are not going to be able to maintain this
> relationship as we do not have the man power for this, alternatively we
> cannot cancel this many orders without upsetting legitimate clients.
>
> Based on my review i have noticed that:
> 1. Whether the customer’s phone number ties to FB is never checked by
> Signifyd.
> 2. In most declined cases the customer is not even Googled.
> 3. Many customers pass the AVS check, but the agent leaves notes stating
> they cannot be tied to the BA and the Delivery address mismatches. It is
> frustrating to see BA and DA mismatch as a reason to decline as so many of
> our customers order the product during a move, and thus their current
> location cannot be considered when determining whether the customer is real
> or not.
>
> If we are going to have to override the capture on our end based on the
> information we find online ourselves for our higher risk customers then it
> does not make sense to pay Signifyd to guarantee low risk customers.
> I look forward to working together to resolve these issues.
> Thank you,
> Alexandra
>
>

> Hello Sherilyn,

> I wanted to reach out to let you know about a process we have in place for
> friendly fraud chargebacks. For the rest of our customer base, we notify
> them that we have the right to do this.

>
> For our Enterprise customers like you, we let you know about this and
> allow you to opt-in or have us do nothing. Please let me know 1. if you are

> answer prior to deciding if this is something that you would like us to do
> on your behalf.

>
> This link provides details
> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/representment/>
> and the below summarizes what Representment is.
>
>
>
>
> Signifyd’s Chargeback Representment Policy
>
> At Signifyd, our goal is to protect merchants against chargebacks
> associated with fraud or unauthorized charges. Occasionally, when we
> review a chargeback that was submitted to us for reimbursement, we conclude
> it may be a case of friendly fraud, where the customer actually purchased
> and received the order but still filed a chargeback with a fraud reason
> code.
>
> In these situations, Signifyd may choose to challenge the chargeback on
> your behalf, per our terms of service <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/>.
>
> If the chargeback you’re requesting reimbursement for meets our reimbursement
> criteria
> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>,
> and we choose to challenge the chargeback, the following will happen:
>
>    - You’ll still be reimbursed for the eligible chargeback per our standard
>    timeline
>    <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>.
>    We won’t hold back reimbursement on an eligible chargeback.
>    - We may ask for more supporting documentation from you to build a
>    stronger case.
>    - We’ll submit a response to the chargeback and update you when we
>    receive a result. (Should you be alerted of the result before us, you’ll
>    need to notify us.)
>
> Note that we’ll only challenge chargebacks that have both met our
> reimbursement criteria AND are suspected of being friendly fraud. (In other
> words, we’ll only challenge chargebacks with a reason code of fraud or
> unauthorized charges that we suspect may truly be a case of friendly fraud.)
>
> If you already dispute chargebacks on your own, you’re not obligated to
> let us contest suspected friendly fraud chargebacks on your behalf;
> however, you must notify us <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/> if you
> successfully challenged a chargeback for which we already paid you a
> reimbursement, so that we may invoice you the recovered funds.
>
>
>
> Sincerely,
>
>
>
> *Raul Reyes*
>
> *Client Services Manager *
>

subject: Unresolved Email: Hey Prashant, Are you interested?
description:
Additional To: prashant@123stores.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Hey Prashant, Are you interested?
Body:
Hey Prashant,

I'm looking at 123stores.com right now and notice on the "Shipping FAQ's"
page mentions only shipping to 48 of the contagious states in the U.S. Is
this because of one of the 3?

1. No distribution
2. Potential fraud
3. Not in your marketing strategy

If you could do a liability shift where you give us all your "risky" orders
and gain more revenue without fear of fraud & chargebacks is that of
interest to you?

We have 5,000 customers, millions of transactions, and a ton of data that
provide real-time insights that might be pertinent or help with expanding
into unreached markets.

Want to jump on a call sometime next week? We'd be happy to share what's
going on in your industry.

Best,

Dustin

Dustin Mena Strategic Development

Phone: (650) 285-5440 ext. 139
Web: www.signifyd.com <http://go.toutapp.com/bf6ae682715d3c064f>
*Email: *dustin.mena@signifyd.com

<http://go.toutapp.com/28d31573ded97c106d>

>> On Wed, Dec 20, 2017 at 10:50 AM, Raul Reyes <raul.reyes@signifyd.com>
>> wrote:
>>
>> Hello Sherilyn,
>>
>>
>>
>> I wanted to reach out to let you know about a process we have in place
>> for friendly fraud chargebacks. For the rest of our customer base, we
>> notify them that we have the right to do this.
>>
>>
>>
>> For our Enterprise customers like you, we let you know about this and
>> allow you to opt-in or have us do nothing. Please let me know 1. if you are
>> OK with us implementing this 2. If you have any questions we can help
>> answer prior to deciding if this is something that you would like us to do
>> on your behalf.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> This link provides details
>> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/representment/>
>> and the below summarizes what Representment is.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> Signifyd’s Chargeback Representment Policy
>>
>> At Signifyd, our goal is to protect merchants against chargebacks
>> associated with fraud or unauthorized charges. Occasionally, when we
>> review a chargeback that was submitted to us for reimbursement, we conclude
>> it may be a case of friendly fraud, where the customer actually purchased
>> and received the order but still filed a chargeback with a fraud reason
>> code.
>>
>> In these situations, Signifyd may choose to challenge the chargeback on
>> your behalf, per our terms of service <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/>.
>>
>> If the chargeback you’re requesting reimbursement for meets our reimbursement
>> criteria
>> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>,
>> and we choose to challenge the chargeback, the following will happen:
>>
>>    - You’ll still be reimbursed for the eligible chargeback per our standard
>>    timeline
>>    <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>.
>>    We won’t hold back reimbursement on an eligible chargeback.
>>    - We may ask for more supporting documentation from you to build a
>>    stronger case.
>>    - We’ll submit a response to the chargeback and update you when we
>>    receive a result. (Should you be alerted of the result before us, you’ll
>>    need to notify us.)
>>
>> Note that we’ll only challenge chargebacks that have both met our
>> reimbursement criteria AND are suspected of being friendly fraud. (In other
>> words, we’ll only challenge chargebacks with a reason code of fraud or
>> unauthorized charges that we suspect may truly be a case of friendly fraud.)
>>
>> If you already dispute chargebacks on your own, you’re not obligated to
>> let us contest suspected friendly fraud chargebacks on your behalf;
>> however, you must notify us <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/> if you
>> successfully challenged a chargeback for which we already paid you a
>> reimbursement, so that we may invoice you the recovered funds.
>>
>>
>>
>> Sincerely,
>>
>>
>>

>>
>> I wanted to reach out to let you know about a process we have in place
>> for friendly fraud chargebacks. For the rest of our customer base, we
>> notify them that we have the right to do this.
>>
>>
>>
>> For our Enterprise customers like you, we let you know about this and
>> allow you to opt-in or have us do nothing. Please let me know 1. if you are
>> OK with us implementing this 2. If you have any questions we can help
>> answer prior to deciding if this is something that you would like us to do
>> on your behalf.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> This link provides details
>> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/representment/>
>> and the below summarizes what Representment is.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> Signifyd’s Chargeback Representment Policy
>>
>> At Signifyd, our goal is to protect merchants against chargebacks
>> associated with fraud or unauthorized charges. Occasionally, when we
>> review a chargeback that was submitted to us for reimbursement, we conclude
>> it may be a case of friendly fraud, where the customer actually purchased
>> and received the order but still filed a chargeback with a fraud reason
>> code.
>>
>> In these situations, Signifyd may choose to challenge the chargeback on
>> your behalf, per our terms of service <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/>.
>>
>> If the chargeback you’re requesting reimbursement for meets our reimbursement
>> criteria
>> <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>,
>> and we choose to challenge the chargeback, the following will happen:
>>
>>    - You’ll still be reimbursed for the eligible chargeback per our standard
>>    timeline
>>    <https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/#policy>.
>>    We won’t hold back reimbursement on an eligible chargeback.
>>    - We may ask for more supporting documentation from you to build a
>>    stronger case.
>>    - We’ll submit a response to the chargeback and update you when we
>>    receive a result. (Should you be alerted of the result before us, you’ll
>>    need to notify us.)
>>
>> Note that we’ll only challenge chargebacks that have both met our
>> reimbursement criteria AND are suspected of being friendly fraud. (In other
>> words, we’ll only challenge chargebacks with a reason code of fraud or
>> unauthorized charges that we suspect may truly be a case of friendly fraud.)
>>
>> If you already dispute chargebacks on your own, you’re not obligated to
>> let us contest suspected friendly fraud chargebacks on your behalf;
>> however, you must notify us <https://www.signifyd.com/terms/> if you
>> successfully challenged a chargeback for which we already paid you a
>> reimbursement, so that we may invoice you the recovered funds.
>>
>>
>>
>> Sincerely,
>>
>>
>>

Subject: Re: Order #4097 Verification
Body:
Hey Carlos,

There were a handful of reasons that caused hesitation on approval for
guarantee:

   - Email profile was recently created (1/15/18 creation date)
   - Low score (Model deemed the order as a very high risk transaction)
   - ID does not match the full name of the order processor (only Surname)
   - 500+ mile separation between IP used to purchase order from billing &
   shipping address

There's just too many red flags on this order to provide our approval
guarantee. Apologies for any inconvenience.

Best regards,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: 42392 - Implementing Signifyd for SNS {TONY - feedback needed}
description:
Additional To: bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com
CC: support+id42392@sdg.zendesk.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: 42392 - Implementing Signifyd for SNS {TONY - feedback needed}
Body:
Hi Brian,

I believe this is something the SNS team will have to decide. Happy to get
on a call with you, the Client and dev team to discuss options.

In the simplest of terms, Signifyd will provide an Approve or Decline
decision. Any order Signifyd approves will be eligible for chargeback
reimbursement. Signifyd will only charge for orders we Approve, we will not
charge for orders that are declined, or orders that are cancelled by the
Client from within the Signifyd Console.

Ariel's assertion is correct-- Signifyd will only be providing Approvals
for a subset of orders (likely the vast majority, however), any order we
don't approve can still be shipped with SNS consent. We also have a process
to resubmit orders for a second review should the SNS team think we made a
mistake, or if they have additional information they think can help lead to
an Approval (positive order history from the customer, communication with
the customer about updated billing/shipping/email address information etc.)

It also makes sense to configure the process to automatically move Signifyd
Approved orders to the next stage of fulfillment (sounds like Storis?), and
leave the Declined orders in some kind of hold status-- which will allow
SNS to try a resubmit if they wish, or ship without our guarantee. We also
have some customers who decide to automatically cancel/void/restock orders
we decline (depending on preference and current processes). However, we
recommend holding them, in case SNS wants to ship without a guarantee, or
try resubmitting for a second review and potentially an chargeback eligible
Approval.

Let me know if this makes sense, or if you have further questions. Also--
happy to get on a call with the greater group to talk through options.

-Tony

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Declined Reimbursement
description:
Additional To: alexandra@endy.com; cole.spear@signifyd.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Declined Reimbursement
Body:
Hello Alexandra,

I wanted to reach out to provide an update. I apologize for the delay, but
our Risk Operations Team is finally done analyzing the data. They are going
to make some Model rule changes that will take into account the
Billing/Shipping mismatch orders and set some additional criteria that will
send more cases to manual review rather than having you resubmit. There are
other thresholds that are looking on updating as well, all to improve your
experience and increase approval rates.

I have also tasked our Fraud Analyst management team to run an audit on
declined manually reviewed cases. They realize that we did make some
human errors that are in line what you reported below and are retraining
the team responsible for reviewing your orders manually. They will update
me once retraining is complete.

Once these changes are implemented, we would like to monitor your account
for a month to see how much of an improvement we see. After the monitoring
period, if you are satisfied with the outcome, Cole will set up a call with
you to discuss your agreement with us.

Please let me know if you would like us to call you sometime this week to
talk about this. I am happy to do so and will also update you once the
changes are implemented.


Sincerely,

*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

>

> going to have our Risk Operations team run an analysis on your account and
> make recommendations. It should take a week or so for them to complete
> this. I'll let you know once they are completed and provide dial-in
> information for a follow-up call.
>
> Sincerely,

> *Raul Reyes*

>> Thanks Raul!
>> I have noticed an increase in declined cases again and most of them are
>> clearly not fraudulent. If we have to manually request to have as many as
>> 10% of our orders re-reviewed we are not going to be able to maintain this
>> relationship as we do not have the man power for this, alternatively we
>> cannot cancel this many orders without upsetting legitimate clients.
>>
>> Based on my review i have noticed that:
>> 1. Whether the customer’s phone number ties to FB is never checked by
>> Signifyd.
>> 2. In most declined cases the customer is not even Googled.
>> 3. Many customers pass the AVS check, but the agent leaves notes stating
>> they cannot be tied to the BA and the Delivery address mismatches. It is
>> frustrating to see BA and DA mismatch as a reason to decline as so many of
>> our customers order the product during a move, and thus their current
>> location cannot be considered when determining whether the customer is real
>> or not.
>>
>> If we are going to have to override the capture on our end based on the
>> information we find online ourselves for our higher risk customers then it
>> does not make sense to pay Signifyd to guarantee low risk customers.
>> I look forward to working together to resolve these issues.

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: 42392 - Implementing Signifyd for SNS {TONY - feedback needed}
description:
Additional To: bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com
CC: support+id42392@sdg.zendesk.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: 42392 - Implementing Signifyd for SNS {TONY - feedback needed}
Body:
Thank you, Brian.

Please let me know if there's anything I can help with.

Also-- do you happen to have the ability to pull a years worth of
historical data for SNS, or know on their side who would? The purpose of
the historical data is to further evaluate risk, and make sure that we can
perform well to the Clients needs. Having the data on hand will ramp up our
learning, specific to the risk thresholds for SNS customers. If you do have
access, I can share a template, or if you can refer me to the right person,
that would also be great!

-Tony

On Mon, Jan 22, 2018 at 2:45 PM, Brian Diedrick <bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com
> wrote:

>
>

>
>
>
>
>
> BD

> *Sent:* Monday, January 22, 2018 10:33 AM

>
> *From:* Tony Neves [mailto:tony.neves@signifyd.com
> <tony.neves@signifyd.com>]
> *Sent:* Monday, January 22, 2018 10:18 AM
> *To:* Brian Diedrick <bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com>
> *Cc:* SDG <support+id42392@sdg.zendesk.com>
> *Subject:* Re: 42392 - Implementing Signifyd for SNS {TONY - feedback
> needed}
>
>
>
> Hi Brian,
>
>
>
> I believe this is something the SNS team will have to decide. Happy to get
> on a call with you, the Client and dev team to discuss options.
>
>
>
> In the simplest of terms, Signifyd will provide an Approve or Decline
> decision. Any order Signifyd approves will be eligible for chargeback
> reimbursement. Signifyd will only charge for orders we Approve, we will not
> charge for orders that are declined, or orders that are cancelled by the
> Client from within the Signifyd Console.
>
>
>
> Ariel's assertion is correct-- Signifyd will only be providing Approvals
> for a subset of orders (likely the vast majority, however), any order we
> don't approve can still be shipped with SNS consent. We also have a process
> to resubmit orders for a second review should the SNS team think we made a
> mistake, or if they have additional information they think can help lead to
> an Approval (positive order history from the customer, communication with
> the customer about updated billing/shipping/email address information etc.)
>
>
>
> It also makes sense to configure the process to automatically move
> Signifyd Approved orders to the next stage of fulfillment (sounds like
> Storis?), and leave the Declined orders in some kind of hold status-- which
> will allow SNS to try a resubmit if they wish, or ship without our
> guarantee. We also have some customers who decide to automatically
> cancel/void/restock orders we decline (depending on preference and current
> processes). However, we recommend holding them, in case SNS wants to ship
> without a guarantee, or try resubmitting for a second review and
> potentially an chargeback eligible Approval.
>
>
>
> Let me know if this makes sense, or if you have further questions. Also--
> happy to get on a call with the greater group to talk through options.
>
>
>
> -Tony
>
>
>
> On Mon, Jan 22, 2018 at 9:56 AM, Brian Diedrick <
> bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com> wrote:

>
>

>
>
>

> configuration differs from Ariel treats below?
>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
>
>
>
> BD

>

> *Ariel Spiegel* (SDG)

> Jan 21, 2:20 PM PST
>
> Hey Brian: Hope you're well. Here's how I'm interpreting this scope for
> this project. Let me know what you think:
>
> - SDG to install the Signifyd module for Magento 1.
> - SDG to then customize Signifyd so that when an order is placed, it is
> first sent to Signifyd, then only when Signifyd approves the order is the
> order sent to Storis.
>
> What we need to understand is if Signifyd is guaranteeing all orders or
> just providing approvals. And, Brian we need your insight here in that the
> SNS Team needs to be aware that we're not sending all orders to Storis when
> they are placed – rather, orders will only be sent when Signifyd approves
> them. This can create a delay in how long it takes an order to show up in
> Storis.
>
> Please advise.
>
> -
> Thank you,
> Ariel Spiegel (SDG)
>
>
>
> [image: Tony Neves]
>
> *Tony Neves*
>
> Jan 18, 3:49 PM PST
>

>

>
> Please use the existing Test team for integration and testing.

> Happy to organize a call as well to discuss anything you'd like. Let me

>
> -Tony
>
>
>
> [image: Brian Died]
>
> *Brian Diedrick*
>
> Jan 18, 3:12 PM PST
>
> Hi SDG and Tony,
>
> Sit n Sleep is ready to implement and test Signifyd. I know you (SDG) have
> done quite a few of these integrations.
>
> TONY – could you please correspond with Ariel and Anthony of SDG (our web
> development shop and trusted partners) to provision an additional Signifyd
> account for them? They will be handling the Magento implementation.

> Ariel/Anthony … goal here would be to place the Signifyd code for testing

> we will not charge for orders that are declined, or orders that are
> cancelled by the Client from within the Signifyd Console.
>
>
>
>         Ariel's assertion is correct-- Signifyd will only be providing
> Approvals for a subset of orders (likely the vast majority, however), any
> order we don't approve can still be shipped with SNS consent. We also have
> a process to resubmit orders for a second review should the SNS team think
> we made a mistake, or if they have additional information they think can
> help lead to an Approval (positive order history from the customer,
> communication with the customer about updated billing/shipping/email
> address information etc.)
>
>
>
>         It also makes sense to configure the process to automatically move
> Signifyd Approved orders to the next stage of fulfillment (sounds like
> Storis?), and leave the Declined orders in some kind of hold status-- which
> will allow SNS to try a resubmit if they wish, or ship without our
> guarantee. We also have some customers who decide to automatically
> cancel/void/restock orders we decline (depending on preference and current
> processes). However, we recommend holding them, in case SNS wants to ship
> without a guarantee, or try resubmitting for a second review and
> potentially an chargeback eligible Approval.
>
>
>
>         Let me know if this makes sense, or if you have further questions.
> Also-- happy to get on a call with the greater group to talk through
> options.
>
>
>
>         -Tony
>
>

subject: Jane, Quick question
description:
Hi Jane,

How has the new position been going so far? In recent conversations with retailers in your industry, they've reported an uptick in fraud loss via credit card chargebacks. Wanted to see if you're experiencing the same problem in your e-comm business lines?

We have 5,000 customers, millions of transactions, and a ton of data. We see a lot of insights that might be pertinent or help you in your new expanded role. 

Would you be open to a quick discussion to see if this can help you guys?



Dustin

subject: Unresolved Email: Signifyd - All Guarantee Emails
description:
Additional To: nfo@growerslights.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Signifyd - All Guarantee Emails
Body:
Hi Kurt,

We are re-implementing the email notification hack which was setup for your
team initially where you get an email for each order guaranteed by
Signifyd.

To be more useful, we can now only send emails when an order is declined by
us. This way, we are only sending a notification alerting you only when
there is any action needed. The email body will include more details about
the order and the guarantee decision made by us.

If you are still monitoring these emails, you will start seeing email
notifications from us for only declined orders. Please do let us know if
you are not interested in these notifications or if they are not useful
anymore we can stop these email notifications altogether.

Thank you,

Fahad

subject: Unresolved Email: Hi Emma, Are you interested?
description:
Additional To: emma.lowry@avon.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Hi Emma, Are you interested?
Body:
Hi Emma,

Wanted to run this by you. Most everyone in the cosmetics industry is
moving away from fraud scoring and flagging and are sick and tired of
overly aggressive auto-filters. If Avon isn't seeing 98.7% + in acceptance
rates your losing money and have fallen behind the curve.

There's a more optimized and predictable way now with a 100% financial
guarantee against fraud; It's called "Liability Shift".You could increase
AVON accepted order amounts, never pay a chargeback again and gain revenue
all by selling nothing further!

Is it worth us talking on the phone 15 minutes for you to learn the
difference between Scoring/Flagging vs Liability shift?

Look forward to hearing from you. As mentioned in the last email. I have
some time end of this week if you're up for it?

Thank you

Dustin

Dustin Mena Strategic Development

Phone: (650) 285-5440 ext. 139
Web: www.signifyd.com <http://go.toutapp.com/bca2329c032369693b>
*Email: *dustin.mena@signifyd.com

<http://go.toutapp.com/a7ca7b5c773e5f8fdd>
  Guaranteed Fraud Protection

subject: Hi Emma, Quick question
description:
Hi Emma,

In recent conversations with retailers in the cosmetic industry, they've reported an uptick in fraud loss via credit card chargebacks. Wanted to see if you're experiencing the same problem in your e-comm business lines?

We have 5,000 customers, millions of transactions, and a ton of data. We see a lot of insights that might I believe are pertinent to Avon.

Would you be open to talk for about 15 minutes to see if this can help you?


Dustin

subject: My past work with Nike - New opp
description:
Hi Steven,

I see you are connected with my former Alfresco colleague Reed Rademaker. We have both since moved on but enjoyed our work with the Nike team. I wanted to reach out because I think the technology and service at my new company may be especially interesting and valuable for you. We leverage big data and machine learning to automate your ecommerce fraud detection. You may be familiar with this as I believe Nike is currently leveraging Feedzai. A major difference in our offering is we offer liability shift, i.e. we tell you if the order is valid or not, and if we are wrong about an orders validity, we reimburse you for the chargeback and related charges. We can even complement Feedzai by reviewing only the orders that system rejects, identifying the false positives, and guaranteeing them at no risk to Nike(liability shift still applies).

If this of interest to you let me know a time that works for you to connect. If not, or if this is out of your scope, just let me know.

Kind regards,     


Gordon McCormick
https://apps.shopify.com/signifyd

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Declined Reimbursement
description:
Additional To: alexandra@endy.com
CC: cole.spear@signifyd.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Declined Reimbursement
Body:
Hello Alexandra,

Below are the reasons that were given to me on the orders you provided.

1. Order # 42437: Account phone number links to customer’s FB *-- AVS zip
only match, BADA do not match. The rule checks for at least a street match
but this order is zip only match, did not fall into rule criteria, was
declined by model score threshold.*
2. Order 42258: PH links to FB, Billing address AVS match.*-- Signifyd
score = 353, did not fall into the rule criteria(Signifyd score >400), was
declined by model score threshold.*
*3. *Order 42266. *The agent was not confident this order was placed by the
cardholder due to avs complete fail and the location of the IP did not help
matters. They recommended resubmitting a new order with the correct
address.  *


In order to help capture these outliers, we have added a rule in addition
to the changed that will send all declines to our Manual Review team.
Please let me know if this answers your questions.

Sincerely,

*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

Body:
Hi Tiffany,


If you could completely remove the risk by accepting orders you would
normally decline and increase revenue by 4% and never pay a chargeback
again, would it be worth it for you to explore?


We've helped several e-commerce retailers manage fraud processes; including
automating transaction review, flagging orders that should be declined and
ensuring good orders so that you can be reimbursed when we make the wrong
call.


With that said, are you available later this week to talk with one of our
solutions specialists?

 Dustin

subject: Connect?
description:
Hi Dave,

I want to share some insight with you that I think aligns with your experience of creating growth through business process improvement.

Magento natively embedded Signifyd's Chargeback Insurance to be accessible at the flip of a switch for preferred protection. This gives us a positive differentiation in terms of systems, process, and performance compared to your current vendor Riskified. 

It's also a big point of market validation in regards to the competitive landscape. You can read more here: 
https://www.signifyd.com/blog/2017/09/27/signifyd-guarantees-fraud-protection-magento-commerce-merchants/


Nick Key

description:

Body:
Hello Yusuf,

Let me ask internally and get back to you with an answer by no later than
tomorrow.

*Raul Reyes*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

On Wed, Jan 31, 2018 at 10:46 AM, Yusuf Poonawala <
Yusuf.Poonawala@boardriders.com> wrote:

> Hi Raul,
>
>
>
> We are starting on the effort on our side to cancel and re-create cases
> for the scenarios where an order is partially fulfilled or is returned.
> Could you please help clarify some of the following points so we can
> proceed correctly on this effort.
>
>
>
> For cases where we have a partial cancel or a partial return, do we still
> need to build the feature to cancel the entire original case and submit a
> new case with the remaining items and amounts? Is there any change on your
> side that would allow updates to an existing case? There was some mention
> of a new feature allowing a case to be updated in SIgnifyd when we last
> met. Wondering if that is something we can leverage here.
>
>
>
> For the above scenario, if the only option is the cancel the case and
> submit a new one, is there a chance that the new case could be declined by
> Signifyd? Or is there some flag or data that we include in the case create
> call to indicate this is a re-creation that should prevent it from being
> treated as a new request and thus give the same outcome as the original
> case?
>
>
>
> Thanks!
>
>
>

> Principal Architect – eCommerce

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: FW: OrdersExportV1_OP.xlsx {Tony - Historical Data For You}
description:
Additional To: bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: FW: OrdersExportV1_OP.xlsx {Tony - Historical Data For You}
Body:
Hi Brian,

Thanks for putting this together.

Quick question-- we noticed that some of the fields to the right of the
file seem incomplete. For example "was order shipped" and "Did it result in
a Chargeback?" column is only filled out for 18 records, while the
"Chargeback Currency" is filled out 63 times. Is there any way to double
check the fields starting from AD and on and make sure that they're all
entered?

The goal is to validate the the approval rate, client manual review rate,
and chargeback rate on a transaction level.

Let me know if you have any questions, or if you want to hop on a quick
call.

Thanks again for helping with this!

-Tony

On Tue, Jan 30, 2018 at 9:32 AM, Brian Diedrick <bdiedrick@wingmanagency.com
> wrote:

> HI Tony,
>
> Please see attached. Hopefully that gives the insight you're after.  If it
> doesn't, then please give me detailed feedback on what to go back and ask
> for from the client.
>
> Best,
>
>
> BD

subject: Referred by Melissa Baird
description:
Hi Taylor,

Melissa just informed me last week that she'd left Draper James. I'd like to bring you up to speed on what we'd been working on over the past couple months.

Based on 2017 Authorize.net reports provided by your finance team, we found you're currently declining about 10% or $500K in annual revenue as a result of strict fraud rules. You also suffered tens of thousands in fraudulent chargebacks.

I'd love to share how we work with merchants to improve those metrics for a guaranteed ROI. Are you available to connect this week?


Nick Key

Body:
Hey Wade,

Apologies for the delayed response as I have been in meetings this
afternoon.

Thanks so much for giving Signifyd a try. We hate to see you go!

We are always looking at ways to make Signifyd better, and would greatly
appreciate any feedback you may have or reasons as to why you uninstalled
our Fraud Screening Services.

If you have a spare moment to chat tomorrow afternoon (2:00pm PST), I'd
love to gather your thoughts over the phone.

Let me know what best works for you. In the meantime, I'll disabled your
account. Please note that it may disrupt your order processing and
fulfillment. Your webmaster can answer any questions regarding your
integration with Signifyd.

Please let me know if there is any questions.

Best,
Ike

>
> Hello,
>
>
>
> Hope all is well! This note is a formal alert that Signifyd will is
> planning to deprecate an internal API in the next 30 days. We're hoping
> that your team takes action to make sure you are not impacted of this
> change.
>
>
>
> Previously we've spoken about your team's use of our API to poll to
> specific endpoints. As a way of minimalizing the impact, we've suggested a

Hi Gina,

Earlier you mentioned that the launch date for DGPB and Signifyd was pushed
back to the 28th, just wanted to check if you can share additional
information as to why the date was pushed?

We're always looking for ways to improve our offering and especially
enhance the on-boarding/integration experience as well. Is there anything
we could have done differently, or anything we can do to make the process
better?

Let us know when you can, thank you!

-- 
Tony

>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Sorry Cole, just sent you a half finished email. Here is all of it!
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Hi Cole,
>>>>>>> Thanks. I am fine with the monthly Min, just wanted to clarify the
>>>>>>> currency so we are on the same page.
>>>>>>> As for wrapping this up quickly, I have no problem with this, but as
>>>>>>> out overall approval rates are not changing, and the change is only on the
>>>>>>> split between manually reviewed and auto approved, I am not sure that your
>>>>>>> risk profile for us is really changing.
>>>>>>> Here are my thoughts on early termination of contract:
>>>>>>> 1. We do not ask for guaranteed rates, I get that fraud is cyclical
>>>>>>> and some months/days/periods may have more fraud than others.
>>>>>>> 2.  With the future being unknown for both of us, I think it is
>>>>>>> reasonable to look at the past. The average approval rates for 2017 have
>>>>>>> been about 98% (please correct me if this is wrong). These are overall
>>>>>>> rates after all resubmissions rather than original decision rates. At
>>>>>>> approximately 100 order we are seeing less than 3 orders declined per day.
>>>>>>> About 70% of the time we still release the product to the customer and have
>>>>>>> received very few chargebacks this way. I think it would be reasonable to
>>>>>>> expect to see similar results going forward on average (30 day period). I
>>>>>>> get that something could happen in the future which would increase real
>>>>>>> fraudulent activity, but chances are it will not increase the approval rate
>>>>>>> permanently.
>>>>>>> 3. If our risk profile really did change significantly long term,
>>>>>>> having an early termination clause would also give you an out from the
>>>>>>> lower rate that you are proposing to us. I see this working in your favour
>>>>>>> as much as in ours.
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> The early termination clause is really a must on my end, but I am
>>>>>>> pretty flexible on what I would consider a material change. The point is,
>>>>>>> at a certain approval rate (consistently over a period of time), the
>>>>>>> partnership just does not make sense as we are having to take on more risk
>>>>>>> than we insure as we rarely cancel orders that are not obviously fraudulent
>>>>>>> (as the risk of upsetting a customer is usually higher than the risk of
>>>>>>> fraud).
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> All good on the other 2 points.
>>>>>>> Thanks and again sorry for the cut off email,
>>>>>>> Alexandra
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> On Feb 12, 2018, at 7:30 PM, Cole Spear <cole.spear@signifyd.com>
>>>>>>> wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> Hi Alexandra - Thanks for your note.  I'll push this deadline to
>>>>>>> Friday, but want to be clear that we have a note into our modeling team to
>>>>>>> revert changes, for the same reason we discussed in my email this morning.
>>>>>>> I want to make sure we aren't providing a short term fix putting ourselves
>>>>>>> in a precarious position re: risk, without an idea of a longstanding
>>>>>>> partnership.   Take a look at the answers to your questions below!
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> 1.  Monthly minimum is in USD.  With the adjustment, you should
>>>>>>> expect to be in the $10,500 USD monthly, on average.  I design the monthly
>>>>>>> minimum to never be in question for reaching, but significant enough to
>>>>>>> hold both teams accountable throughout the term.
>>>>>>> 2.  Ending a contract early isn't in the spirit of a long term
>>>>>>> contract.  The reason why we don't put things like "guaranteed rates" in
>>>>>>> our contract, is due to the fact that we don't know what the future holds.
>>>>>>> For example, if a fraud ring were to target your site, and all of a sudden
>>>>>>> 2,000 extra fraudulent orders came into your queue, Signifyd's approval
>>>>>>> rate would drop significantly, when in reality our system was working just
>>>>>>> as it is supposed to.   Can I ask what you have in mind for a materially
>>>>>>> significant change?
>>>>>>> 3.  We are able to filter out orders, though I want to make sure
>>>>>>> there's no issue with you hitting a monthly minimum, so we'll need to
>>>>>>> determine things before moving forward - I want to make sure we never have
>>>>>>> to charge you for services unused because you didn't hit the minimum.
>>>>>>> 4.  No restriction to cancel orders (Other than a 30-day cutoff
>>>>>>> after the transaction), though our team monitors the cancellations for
>>>>>>> quality control purposes (Just like the conversations we've been having re:
>>>>>>> manual review times, which hopefully our model adjustment is mitigating).
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> I hope this information is helpful - Happy to continue the
>>>>>>> discussion should anything come up,
>>>>>>> Cole
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>> On Mon, Feb 12, 2018 at 8:01 AM, Alexandra Voyevodina <
>>>>>>> alexandra@endy.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Thanks for such a quick response Cole! I think Wednesday may be a
>>>>>>>> bit tight but we can shoot to have everything wrapped up for Friday. I have
>>>>>>>> a few questions:
>>>>>>>> 1. Monthly min, is that in USD or CAD?
>>>>>>>> 2. Can either party end the agreement early should the approval
>>>>>>>> rate change materially? (open to discussion on what that change would be)
>>>>>>>> 3. Can we remove from auto submission all financed orders? These do
>>>>>>>> not need to be insured as payment does not go to us but to the finance
>>>>>>>> company which eventually pays us out. The full amount of the order is not
>>>>>>>> actually paid by customer up front so it makes no sense to insure the full
>>>>>>>> amount (meaning, even if there was a chargeback it would be for a much
>>>>>>>> smaller $).
>>>>>>>> 4. Do we have any restriction on canceling orders- for example, if
>>>>>>>> review is taking too long.
>>>>>>>>
>>>>>>>> Thank you!
>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>> Alexandra - Thanks again for the time on Friday.  As always, I

>>>>>>>> over the weekend and socialized with the team, ways that we can close out

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Harold Freeman Jewelers | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: carlos@c2cg.net
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: image.png, image.png, image.png

Subject: Re: Harold Freeman Jewelers | Signifyd
Body:
Hey Carlos,

After touching bases with our product team, one thing I've confirmed is
that copying the key from auth.net into signifyd does not work. The error
message you received last time is indicative that the login ID/key
combination is not valid.

You'll have to use the un-encrypted key, which is not view-able in auth.net.
Hopefully you'll have it tracked but if you don't, you'll have to generate
a new key. A newly generated key automatically expires an old key so you'll
need to replace it in all the places where the key is configured (The
website, back-end platform, etc.) otherwise checkouts may fail.

Let me know if you're still continuing to have issues.

Thanks,
Ike



Powered by Gmelius <https://gmelius.com?ref=mail>

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Question
description:
Additional To: alexandra@endy.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Question
Body:
Hey Alexandra, hope you had a great week. Thank you for bringing these
orders to our attention. I sat down with our Fraud team to better
understand why they were rejected and gathered the following details.

   - 43762: This was the first time we saw this customer email in our
   system. As there was no previous history of this customer as well as some
   inconsistencies in the address, the decision was to reject.
   - 44118: The email *(endy.com@lurkmore.com <endy.com@lurkmore.com>)* listed
   for this order was the single reason for the rejection. This seemed like a
   malicious email tied to a wikipage that also looked suspicious. However,
   after deeper investigation, we do believe this is the domain owner of the
   wikipage and also the email domain.

After further reviewing both of these orders, we will be approving both.
Please re-submit the orders and we they will be Guaranteed by Signifyed.
Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, please don't hesitate to
reach out again anytime with questions or concerns. We will definitely take
this and future opportunities to train our model as well as our manual
review team.

Have a great weekend.


*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

On Fri, Feb 16, 2018 at 6:55 AM, Alexandra Voyevodina <alexandra@endy.com>
wrote:

> Hi Raul,
> Hope you are well. I am hoping you could help me understand a specific
> decline situation that we run into time to time.
> We often see transactions that go though with an AVS match, BILLING+
> SHIPPING match, and with a high score, that get declined because the email,
> phone number or delivery address cannot be tied to the card holder.
> For example please see order 43762  or order 44118. While I do believe
> that there must be some way of committing fraud this way, I cannot
> understand what it is. Could you please shed some light on how someone can
> have a billing and AVS match and ship to their own house, but still be a
> fraudulent customer? As we ship out many orders that are declined by
> Signifyd, to avoid upsetting real customers, I am trying to get a better
> understanding of our risk there.
> Thanks in advance for your help!
> Alexandra

We have seen cases where a fraudster has stolen credit card information and
has learned when the cardholder will not be at home. They will note that on
the delivery window. We have also had cases where a person living at the
residence has used another's card without permission. Does this help answer
your question?

Sincerely,

*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

www.signifyd.com

Subject: Mead Johnson | Signifyd Client Service Manager Update
Body:
Hello Sheri,

I hope you had a great weekend. I wanted to let you know that I am moving
on from Signifyd. I have been offered a great opportunity that I have to
try. I enjoyed working with you and I wish you continued success.

Jasal Motiram is taking over as your Client Services Manager. He has been
fully briefed on all of the existing account activities, so the transition
will be seamless.

Kind Regards,

*Raul Reyes*

*Client Services Manager *

*SIGNIFYD*

2540 North 1st Street Suite 300

San Jose, CA 95131

phone: (650) 285-5440 Ext. 2024

email: raul.reyes@signifyd.com

www.signifyd.com

subject: Your chargebacks from last month
description:
Hi Jamie,

Are you familiar with how to shift financial liability for fraud off your company? Signifyd is protecting billions of dollars in revenue by shifting fraud liability away from our merchants.

We'll review all of your online transaction before shipment to verify their legitimacy, and reimburse you for any fraud that occurs after. This allows you to take a hands-free approach to fraud and also guarantees a return on investment as we'll beat your cost of fraud.

Can we schedule some time to see if this fits any of your eCommerce initiatives?

Kind regards,


Gordon McCormick
Senior Account Executive I Signifyd
Signifyd.com

Nick Key

subject: Unresolved Email: Business Review Request
description:
Additional To: slobodan.milnovic@foreo.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Business Review Request
Body:
Hello Slobodan,

I would really like to do a business review with you.  On that call we will
review Foreo approval rates with Signifyd.  As well as discuss some new
fraud patterns we are seeing.  I think this will be a really beneficial
call for you and anyone on your team that would like to join.  On this call
I will share my screen.  This should not take more than 30 minutes.

Would any of the following times work for you:

Monday March 12th @ 3.00 pm UTC
Wednesday March 14th @ 3.00 pm UTC or 4.00 pm UTC
Thursday March 15th @  3.00 pm UTC or 4.00 pm UTC
Friday March 16th @  3.00 pm UTC or 4.00 pm UTC

Please let me know what time works best and I will send out the meeting
invite.

I look forward to hearing back from you!
Best,
Oddny

Oddny Johannesson
Client Services Manager
Signifyd

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Chargeback claim #515900198
description:
Additional To: slandry@sail.ca
CC: varbour@sail.ca; ndens@sail.ca; hsavard@sail.ca
BCC: 
Attachment: image003.jpg, image002.jpg

Subject: Re: Chargeback claim #515900198
Body:
Hi Stephanie,

Thank you for writing in. Unfortunately this claim is ineligible because
the 30-day window has expired.

If Signifyd's Claims team reviews the claim and determines that information
is missing, we'll reach out to the contact who filed the claim and request
the information. Merchants will have 30 days from the date of our request
to provide said information before the claim is automatically declined and
ineligible for further review.

Signifyd sent a request to comptabilite@sail.ca on 1/22/18 however we did
not receive a follow-up in the 30-day threshold.

Please let me know if you have any questions or in need of additional
clarification.

Best regards,
Ike

>> *From:* Stephen Cisick [mailto:steve@technologycopilot.com
>> <steve@technologycopilot.com>]
>> *Sent:* Friday, March 02, 2018 2:56 PM
>> *To:* Brandon Michaud <brandonmichaud@hernmarine.com>
>> *Cc:* Jim Stewart <jim.stewart@hernmarine.com>
>> *Subject:* Signify Manual Order Integration Requirements
>>
>>
>>
>> Brandon/Jim,
>>
>>
>>
>> I hope all is well.
>>
>>
>>
>> Here is what I believe you want with the Signify integration with your
>> manual order process.
>>
>>
>>
>> Let me know if you have any questions.
>>
>>
>>
>> *Summary*
>>
>> Hern Marine (HM) would like to add fraud detection to their manual order
>> process.  Current, they integrate with a service called Signify.  This
>> integration is only for orders imported from their Big Commerce (BC)
>> shopping cart.  Manual orders are currently not handled whatsoever when
>> they are placed in Stone Edge with respect to fraud detection.  HM has
>> asked Technology Copilot (TC) look at integrating the Signify fraud
>> detection into it’s manual orders.
>>
>>
>>
>> *Details*
>>
>> At the Stone Edge manual order entry screen.  At the time the order is
>> saved:
>>
>>    - Connect to the Signify service via their published API.
>>    https://www.signifyd.com/docs/api/
>>    <https://www.signifyd.com/docs/api/>
>>    - Send the order information to the API and receive a response
>>       - If the response indicates fraud, mark the order as “*Fraud Check
>>       CVV*” using a Stone Edge order state.
>>       - If the response indicates the order is good, let the user save
>>       the order as if it was a ‘normal’ order taken over the phone.
>>       - If the response indicates that more time is needed in order to
>>       make a fraud decision, an order state “*PENDING SIGNIFY*” will be
>>       set on the manual indicating that it’s being checked for Fraud by Signify
>>       and it’s final disposition will be finalized eventually.
>>    - Order notes will indicate what happened with response data from
>>    Signify.
>>
>>
>>
>> A separate process will be created which will handle check all of the
>> orders which are in the pending state (waiting for Signify to complete
>> final disposition of the order)  The separate process will specifically:
>>
>>    - Keep track of all of the orders which are in the pending state and
>>    will check each one of them with the Signify API to see if a final fraud
>>    disposition has been made by Signify.
>>    - If the final disposition has been made, the process will mark the
>>    following order states:
>>       - If it’s marked as fraud, it will mark the order as “*Fraud Check
>>       CVV*” using the Stone Edge order state
>>       - If it’s indicates the order is good, it will mark the order as
>>       good by selecting another order state “*SIGNIFY AOK*” that can
>>       then be picked up by HM personnel to them move the order along to fulfill.
>>       - If no change in the order, it will check that order again, the
>>       next time it runs.
>>    - Order notes will indicate what happened with response data from
>>    Signify.
>>
>>
>>
>> *Notes*
>>
>>    - In order to communicate with the Signify API for an existing order,
>>    a case ID is required.  For BigCommerce Orders, HM currently needs to
>>    periodically manually check orders that are pending to see if they have had
>>    their final order disposition.
>>    - If HM can get the Case ID to be downloaded as part of the BC order,
>>    the separate process that checks orders could automate this checking for HM
>>    so that they will no longer need to manually go to the Signify site.
>>    - In order to do this, changes will be required so that the case ID
>>    is made available in BC and the case ID stored in the same location that
>>    the manual order case ID is stored.
>>    - These changes should be minimal on the TC side.  HM should find out
>>    in the BC what it would take to get the case ID available.
>>
>>
>>
>> *Estimate*
>>
>> Custom DLL to format JSON request data
>> -              1-2
>>
>> Custom After Manual Order save Call
>>                -              2-3
>>
>> Custom External Process to update orders
>> -              2-3
>>
>> TC Notification Integration
>>                                         -               1-1
>>
>> Testing/install
>>          -              1-2
>>
>>
>>
>> Total
>>         -              7-11 Hours
>>
>>
>>
>> Sincerely,
>>
>>   Steve Cisick
>>
>>
>>
>> President
>>
>> Technology Copilot, LLC
>>

>>

Subject: Taylor Stitch | Signifyd
Body:
Hello,

After a review of Taylor Stitch’s account, our records indicate that
Signifyd is carrying a $19,610.33 balance in past due accounts receivable
for our fraud prevention services. Although we have sent [numerous]
notice[s] of this past due amount since 11/3/2017, we have not received any
payment [or response].

Please contact us immediately at billing@signifyd.com to resolve the
balance on your account. If payment is not received by 3/23/18, within 15
days of this notice, we will be forced to suspend or terminate your access
to your Signifyd account and your use of our fraud prevention services for
Taylor Stitch.

Please note that, depending on your integration with Signifyd, this may
disrupt your order processing and fulfillment. Your webmaster can answer
any questions regarding your integration with Signifyd.

If you have already sent us your payment, please confirm with
billing@signifyd.com when we can expect to receive the payment. Thank you
very much for your attention to this matter and your continued business

Kind Regards,
Ike

description:

CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Signifyd Follow-up: Macs4u.com
Body:
Hi Silke,

After reviewing the order it appears we've had some difficulties tying the
card holder to a number of areas:

   - Billing address
   - Delivery address
   - Email

The email age states that it was recently created (48 hours ago).

We also viewed that there was a NonFixedVOIP being used. We have
hesitations around this due to the fact the Phone number can easily be
manipulated and makes the order suspicious.

I can try to run this through another analyst for review but there's a
number of factors that has caused us to decline.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Ike

subject: Increase the effectiveness and efficiency of operations
description:
Hi Servane,

I stole that line directly from your LinkedIn. I did it because it made me want to reach out to you because I think Signifyd can do just that.  

With Signifyd when anyone purchases from your site, our platform will tell you whether the buyer is fraudulent in less than half a second so you can ship with piece of mind. And if we are wrong we will pay the chargeback and all applicable fees. Very simply put, we remove the task of reviewing transactions, and take all of the fraud liability from you. 

If this sounds worthy of further discussion please let me know. I think we can help. 

Kind regards,


Gordon McCormick
Senior Account Executive I Signifyd
Signifyd.com

Body:
Hi Joe,

Apologies for the delayed response.

We declined the order yesterday afternoon. We declined it for the following
reasons:

   1. Could not tie the cardholder to the email address provided
   2. Could not tie the cardholder to the phone number provided
   3. Could not tie the cardholder to the billing address provided
   4. Could not tie the cardholder to the delivery address provided

There was a note on the order that stated that the card holder recently
moved to Brooklyn so if you can get any verified documents showing the
cardholder's ties to the new address, we can review the order another time.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
Ike

description:
Hi Steven,

It seems like you have a very measurable and even binary impact through your role at Fossil Group. That's exactly how I think of online credit card fraud.

Signifyd provides binary decisions to accept or reject online consumer orders and with that, we either insure or don't insure the full value of your merchandise against chargebacks.

The Swatch Group sees 3 financial impacts from our service:
1. Chargebacks eliminated
2. Higher order acceptance > top line
3. Reduced overhead allocation


Nick Key
