subject: Unresolved Email: Re: [EXT] Re: Signifyd & Goodyear
description:
Additional To: bridgette_berthelot@goodyear.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: [EXT] Re: Signifyd & Goodyear
Body:
Hi Bridgette,

Congrats on your position with Goodyear!  Wanted to send a personal note to say nice to emeet you!  I’ve been working with Jay and Aaron closely through the whole process and am very excited about working with you guys on this project.

I’m out of the country but will return next Monday so please reach out to Skye + team with anything you need ASAP as I’ve got a time delay of about 9 hours right now.

I believe you have the contract we’ve sent but your team would be sending over your paper; is that still the case?

Ali

Sent from my iPhone

> On Mar 19, 2018, at 1:16 PM, Bridgette Berthelot <bridgette_berthelot@goodyear.com> wrote:
> 
> Skye,
>  
> Thank you.  I look forward to working with you and I will be in contact should I need any additional information. In the interim, should you need anything please do not hesitate to contact me.
>  
> Thank you and have a great day.
>  
> Bridgette L. Berthelot
> Sr. Category Lead, Marketing & Communication, the Americas
> Global Procurement Marketing & Retail
> 330.796.6132
> bridgette­_berthelot@goodyear.com
>  
> From: Skye Spear [mailto:skye.spear@signifyd.com] 
> Sent: Monday, March 19, 2018 3:27 AM
> To: Nancy Ross <nancy_ross@goodyear.com>
> Cc: Ali Smith <ali.smith@signifyd.com>; J Bennett <j.bennett@signifyd.com>; Jay Robinson <jay_robinson@goodyear.com>; Michael Snowbarger <michael_snowbarger@goodyear.com>; Bridgette Berthelot <bridgette_berthelot@goodyear.com>
> Subject: Re: [EXT] Re: Signifyd & Goodyear
>  
> Hi Nancy,
>  
> Thank you for the update, and thank you also for the introduction to Bridgette (very nice to meet you, Bridgette).
>  
> We'll update our timeline on our side to align with your process.  Thank you for the visibility into the procurement steps.  That's very helpful for our resource allocation.
>  
> Bennett should still be the POC for the Security conversation, and Bennett, Ali, and I will all be involved from the contract side.
>  
> Bridgette, please let me know what you need from our side to start the contract management process as well as the broader Security conversation.
>  
> Thank you!
>  
> Skye
>  
> On Fri, Mar 16, 2018 at 11:15 AM, Nancy Ross <nancy_ross@goodyear.com> wrote:
> Hi Ali, Skye and Bennett:
>  
> Hope all is well with you.  Ali, thanks for your messages.
>  
> I’d like to introduce you to Bridgette Berthelot.  She recently started with Goodyear last week, and is my new manager.  Bridgette will be taking over this projects and be your POC now.
>  
> In terms of timing, I would guess that it will take us a month to get through all of the various requirements; then a few days for the agreement to be signed and a PO issued for your planning purposes.
> I’ve reviewed your agreements with Bridgette, and she can start the contracts management, reach out to IT Security and start the ABDD process.  Would you still want Bennet (Chief of Staff) to be the POC for the IT Security and ABDD?
>  
> Thanks!
>  
> Nancy Ross
> Associate Category Lead – Marketing, the Americas
> The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company
> 200 Innovation Way, Akron OH 44316
> 330.796.7866
> nancy_ross@goodyear.com
>  
> From: Skye Spear [mailto:skye.spear@signifyd.com] 
> Sent: Thursday, March 15, 2018 2:04 AM
> To: Ali Smith <ali.smith@signifyd.com>
> Cc: Nancy Ross <nancy_ross@goodyear.com>; Jay Robinson <jay_robinson@goodyear.com>; Michael Snowbarger <michael_snowbarger@goodyear.com>
> Subject: [EXT] Re: Signifyd & Goodyear
>  
>  WARNING - External email; exercise caution.
>  
> 
> Thanks Ali.  
>  
> Nancy, nice to meet you.  Any update you might be able to give on procurement/legal requirements and timeline for completion would be helpful as we've been reserving onboarding slots on our Professional Services team for Goodyear in the event that we're able to start the process.
>  
> If we know the dates are going to be later we can reassign some resources to other deployments and adjust the schedule for when Goodyear might be ready.
>  
> I'm also happy to answer any questions you might have throughout the review.
>  
> Thank you,
>  
> Skye
>  
>  
>  
> On Wed, Mar 14, 2018 at 8:51 AM, Ali Smith <ali.smith@signifyd.com> wrote:
> Hi Nancy,
>  
> Want to send a quick note to update your team on coverage while my email access is limited during vacation.  Skye Spear, cc'd and Bennett who I have intro'd previously will be here to help.  Please reply to this email with any questions.  
>  
> Has there been any progress on the Goodyear paperwork, IT Security meeting and Center of Excellence anti-bribery processes?
>  
> Let us know what we can do to help!
>  
> Ali
> 
> 
>  
> On Fri, Feb 16, 2018 at 7:47 AM, Nancy Ross <nancy_ross@goodyear.com> wrote:
> Hello, Ali:
>  
> My name is Nancy Ross, and I work in the marketing procurement area at Goodyear.  I know you have been working with Aaron, Jay and Michael on a proposal; I will be your procurement POC.
>  
> Regarding the attached agreement that you sent:  It will expedite things if we use Goodyear’s agreement in this process.  Having said that, there are portions of your agreement that we will incorporate into our agreement as redlines since our agreement tends to be more services based and yours is more subscription based.  I have this request in with Contracts Management; they will insert the appropriate verbiage into our agreement as redlines and your legal team can redline further etc.  I would expect this should take at least a week to have ready for you, based on their current workload.
>  
> Can you further outline / breakdown the fees portion of the agreement, as shown below?
> Fees: Subscriber agrees to send Signifyd [all] e-commerce transactions that Subscriber receives through the Subscriber Storefront for review under the Fraud Screening Services.
> For this service, Signifyd will charge 75.00 basis points of the aggregate Order Amount of all Submitted Transactions that result in Affirmative Advisory Notices (the “Guarantee Fee”); provided, however, that such fee rate is contingent on Signifyd’s validation of historical transaction data provided by Subscriber in accordance with Section 4 below.
> Beginning on the first full calendar month after the initial subscription term, Signifyd will charge Subscriber a monthly fee equal to the greater of (x) the aggregate Guarantee Fees for such month or (y) $[____].

subject: InMail from Sales Navigator
description:
Hi Jasmine,

I want to resurface my invitation to connect live over the phone and discuss how we could make your job as Deciem's fraud prevention Lead a lot easier.

Our merchant partners see a significant reduction in time and resources spent reviewing orders for fraud and we guarantee that you'll never pay for chargebacks again.

Would you see this as advantageous to your work at Deciem?

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Meeting Next Week
description:
Additional To: lani_lautoa@gymboree.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: ~WRD000.jpg, image001.jpg

Subject: Re: Meeting Next Week
Body:
Is that a Scoring platform your in a contract with? This might help. With
Signifyd you would
give us your worst orders, the really bad ones.

The ones that you automatically block at checkout, those odd-looking orders
that you manually decline because they look really fishy, the ones where
the billing & shipping don’t match or that have international shipping, and
the ones where you have to call the customer 3 times, leave them messages,
send them e-mails, and then when they do eventually decide to call you back
they’re irate and yell at you because you haven’t yet shipped their order.

We’ll take the liability, and the financial risk of any chargebacks you
incur. And if one slips by us, you’ll be reimbursed within 48 hours for the
full value of the order, plus tax, plus shipping, plus the chargeback fee
you received from the bank.

Let me know if that helps, Still don't think it would be a waste of time to
just have an open chat next week.

Just let me know.

Matt

Subject: Re: Meeting Next Week
To: Lani Lautoa <Lani_Lautoa@gymboree.com>


Is that a Scoring platform your in a contract with? This might help. With
Signifyd you would
give us your worst orders, the really bad ones.

The ones that you automatically block at checkout, those odd-looking orders
that you manually decline because they look really fishy, the ones where
the billing & shipping don’t match or that have international shipping, and
the ones where you have to call the customer 3 times, leave them messages,
send them e-mails, and then when they do eventually decide to call you back
they’re irate and yell at you because you haven’t yet shipped their order.

We’ll take the liability, and the financial risk of any chargebacks you
incur. And if one slips by us, you’ll be reimbursed within 48 hours for the
full value of the order, plus tax, plus shipping, plus the chargeback fee
you received from the bank.

Let me know if that helps, Still don't think it would be a waste of time to
just have an open chat next week.

Just let me know.

Matt

traffic in January and a majority of those orders were approved for
guarantee:

*Sep'17* *Oct'17* *Nov'17* *Dec'17* *Jan'18* *Feb'18* *Mar'18*

Txns Approved AD 11 19 14 18 47 20 26

Txns Declined 30 42 35 27 15 11 16
Txns Declined AD 27 35 35 22 14 9 9
Txns Declined MR 3 7 0 5 1 2 7
Txns Canceled 1 1 0 1 0 0 4

Let me know if there was a particular area within this data that you would
like further examination on.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Meeting Follow up
description:
Additional To: ajohnson@gotrg.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Meeting Follow up
Body:
Hi Anastasyia,

Thank you for taking the time to speak with us today.

In order for Signifyd to perform more accurate risk assessments and
ultimately approve more orders, our risk team has asked if it's possible
for you to share BIN #, Device_ID, and the last 4 digits of the card used.
This will help us verify a variety of orders including those of repeat
customers such as Nathan Bartow.

Have you identified any other repeat customers that experiencing issues
with approvals such as Nathan Bartow? Please provide me with the names of
these customers and I will share with my risk team.

Thank you,
Tyler

--

Subject: Re: Thank You
Body:
Happy to hear that Alexandra. I will pull the actual orders that I see as
resubmits. You mentioned you were including declines orders, my numbers do
not reflect that, only orders that have been flagged as "resubmitted".

Thank you for your patience and for working so closely with us. We will
continue to monitor the account and ensure success!

Have a great evening,

Jasal

On Thu, Apr 12, 2018 at 12:32 PM, Alexandra Voyevodina <alexandra@endy.com>
wrote:

> Thank you for looking into it.
> As for the resubmissions, there is no easy way for me to check since I do
> not currently track orders that were resubmitted and approved. Only
> resubmitted and declined…
> I have checked Resubmitted and declined for March and the total is at
> least 14. In addition, I found 3 orders that were resubmitted and approved,
> but like I said, there are likely more, as I do not track these.
> Do you have details of which 6 transactions are showing as resubmitted on
> your end in March? I wonder why we are seeing such different numbers.
>
> Overall, without digging in any further, I do agree that we are
> resubmitting fewer transactions, especially given that the volume has only
> been increasing. I appreciate all your efforts there, it definitely helps
> having someone dedicated to monitoring and making tweaks on our account :).
> Alexandra
>

subject: Congrats on the new role!
description:
Hi Jon,

I talked with Robert Harris a while back about Loxa's ecommerce systems and I'd love to pick up a conversation with you about CosmoProf now that it seems you're focused on ecomm specifically.

Cybersource is a great processor but their Decision Manager fraud tool is a bit outdated. Signifyd is doing a lot of new things to change the fraud prevention space like Chargeback Reimbursement -so much so that Cybersource founder, Bill McKiernan, sits on our board.

Do you have any time to connect this week?




Nick Key

subject: Unresolved Email: Signifyd| Account Update
description:
Additional To: david@adrenalineworld.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Signifyd| Account Update
Body:
Hello David,

Hope all is well! I noticed that no one from your team has logged into
Signifyd in quite some time, and so I am writing to check in.

If you’d like to continue using Signifyd’s Fraud Screening Services, please
let me know and I’d be happy to chat live or point you to the services in
Signifyd’s console that you haven’t been taking advantage of.

If you aren’t interested in Signifyd’s Fraud Screening Services, can you
please confirm that we should close your Signifyd account?

   -

   Please note that, depending on your integration with Signifyd, canceling
   your account may disrupt your order processing and fulfillment. Your
   webmaster can answer any questions regarding your integration with Signifyd.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best,

Fahad Khan

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: example for review
description:
Additional To: orderprocessing@paulcbuff.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: image002.png, image003.png, image005.png, image001.png, image004.png

Subject: Re: example for review
Body:
Hi Mindy,

I see what you mean, the Signifyd console is not capturing the business
names which are often connected to the card holder. While our fraud agents
are trained to make these connections on their own, I can certainly see the
benefit of having them in the console. This option is currently unavailable
but I will document this as a feature request on your account's behalf.

In the future, if an order such as this goes into manual review, please
include the corresponding screenshot and pdf which you shared with me to
help improve the order's likeliness to be approved.

Thank you,
Tyler

subject: Unresolved Email: Chargeback on Order ID W7453575
description:
Additional To: creditandcollections@scripco.com
CC: chargebacks@signifyd.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Chargeback on Order ID W7453575
Body:
Hello Scrip Companies Team,

https://app.signifyd.com/cases/606956748

At Signifyd, we are always looking for ways to protect you from fraud.

It appears from our review that the chargeback on this order may be a case
of friendly fraud and we would like to challenge the chargeback on your
behalf. Challenging chargebacks protects your brand and your reputation
with both your processor and the banks involved. It also discourages
dishonest buyers from further targeting your store and abusing the
chargeback process to receive free merchandise. Learn more about Signifyd's
Chargeback Representment Policy *here*
<https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/representment/>
.

As this is an Eligible Chargeback for reimbursement, please note that *you
will still be reimbursed per our standard process* while we prepare for
representment and challenge the chargeback.

We would appreciate a response on or before *2018-04-30*, so we can meet
the timeline required to challenge the chargeback. Please provide the
following information to assist us in challenging the chargeback on your
behalf:



*- sales invoice- transaction details including AVS and CVV/CVC response-
customer contact (email, chat logs) pertaining to this order*

*Please let us know if you would like to move forward with us challenging
this chargeback on your behalf and other chargebacks we may find are cases
of friendly fraud.*

We look forward to your response and please let us know if you have any
questions.

Thank you,
Tyler Colopy

-- 
[image: Signifyd]
Tyler Colopy
Client Services Manager, Signifyd

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Eternity US and Signifyd Integration
description:
Additional To: megha@hepta.me
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Eternity US and Signifyd Integration
Body:
Hi Megha,

For most of your orders, it looks like we are receiving the fields we'd
expect. This order
<https://app.signifyd.com/v2/cases/645358753/requests/creation> is a good
example of most of the data points we'd expect, with the exception of
missing:

   - shipments - shipper
   - userAccount - accountNumber, aggregateOrderCount, aggregateOrderDollars

A few things to note about testing:

   - Test teams and test orders are used primarily to ensure data quality
   and integrity. It is not intended to evaluate Signifyd quarantee deicision
   on any particular order since during testing, no orders are sent to manual
   review.
   - Specifically related to the orders that have been sent, while we've
   received most of the data we expect, our system seems many orders from the
   same email address for large dollar amounts in a short period of time. In a
   real life scenario, that is suspicious and these orders would likely be
   routed to a manual review within Signifyd.
   - All orders are for several thousand dollars with a billing/shipping in
   India and a US credit card. To simulate an approved order, you can likely:
      - reduce the dollar amount on the order (say, $5 USD)
      - use a different confirmation email
      - ensure the credit card BIN matches the billing/delivery address

Let me know if you have any additional questions. I'd be happy to schedule
a call to discuss further as well.

Thanks,
Matt

Body:
Mykola,

Signifyd's role is to guide the automation. Typically fulfillment is
triggered in Shopify after the payment is captured. Not the other way
around, its how Shopify is designed to help automate fulfillment.

We're not aware of any apps that would satisfy this request. Apologies for
any inconvenience that this causes.

Best,
Ike

Body:
Hi Sandy,

Hope all is well! One of your customers reached to Signifyd due to a
blacklist distinction we placed on him awhile back. I was hoping to gather
how your team communicates with your customers if Signifyd declines an
order and your team's playbook for other Signifyd decisions.

I'd love to hop on a call sometime this week. Feel free to provide me with
a couple of dates and times that best work for you.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Meeting Follow Up
description:
Additional To: michael.biederman@allycommerce.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: Meeting Follow Up
Body:
Hi Michael,

Fraud rate is a broad term that can be used to describe a variety of
different metrics, would you mind clarifying what it is you're looking for?
Once you get back to me I'll see what I can pull from the back end, but in
the meantime you can pull all order and claim history by brand directly
from the Signifyd dashboard to show approvals, declines, and cancelations
as well as claims that were paid, approved, declined, or cancelled.

Thanks,
Tyler

On Fri, May 11, 2018 at 8:50 AM, Michael Biederman <
michael.biederman@allycommerce.com> wrote:

Hi Chelsea,

My name is Ike from Signifyd and I wanted to work with your team on a
recent item we've discovered from your team. We recently received a email
from you on May 9th with a card holder's credit card and ID information.
We're hopeful that your team can begin adding attachments like this to the
order on the Signifyd portal as compared to sending it via email.

*For PCI compliance reasons, Signifyd is requesting that all cardholder
information (ID, CC, etc) is stored on the console and moved away from
distribution via email*.

Cardholder data is stored on the console for 14 days before it is deleted
and removed.

We're hopeful that this change can be made to your workflow immediately. We
can hop on a quick call if you're in need of additional clarity.

I look forward to hearing back.

Best regards,
Ike
-- 
[image: Signifyd] <https://www.signifyd.com/>
Ike Ogamba

San Jose, CA 95131

<https://www.signifyd.com/customers/>



Not using Gmelius <https://gmelius.com?ref=mail> yet?

subject: Unresolved Email: Ahava | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: bethann@ahavaus.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Ahava | Signifyd
Body:
Hi Beth,

I recently sent an email to the Ahava team because Signifyd is processing
personal information that has been passed from your e-commerce storefront
as part of its Fraud Screening Services for individuals located in the
European Economic Area or Switzerland (collectively, the EU), which means
the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) likely applies to your
organization and our services. If you have yet to accept the docusign, you
can access our GDPR Addendum here
<https://na3.docusign.net/Member/PowerFormSigning.aspx?PowerFormId=50e23182-b6ad-4ebd-a1fb-ec714ffc8b83>,
which has already been executed by Signifyd, so that we can comply with the
requirements of GDPR ahead of its enforcement.

If you are not the person in your organization responsible for GDPR
compliance, please forward this email to your Legal or Compliance team.

Feel free to let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,
Ike

--

subject: Congrats on the promotion! Is any new fraud/liability problems on your radar now?
description:
Congrats on your recent promotion, Javier!

Now what e-commerce needs do you have?

I noticed you are experienced at mitigating risks and wanted to connect on how to not only outsource the liability of fraud, but, decrease your decline rate, as well as automate any manual review process you may have in place.

Signifyd provides guaranteed-fraud protection for online retailers to help generate more sales, and eliminate the stress of reviewing orders and paying for chargebacks.

Would you be open to learning more about what it means to be protected by Signifyd?

Cheers,
Leanne




Leanne Mansfield

Hey Sheri, I escalated this to the product team and after further
investigation, it looks like the order timed out in Shopify. Our logs show
that we saw the order, and tried to accept it, but something got stuck on
the Shopify side. Not quite sure what the issue is there, but unfortunately
this is not something we would be able to fix from our end.

Hope this helps. Have a great weekend.

Jasal

Body:
Hi Chase,

I was able to find the orders and have included the URL for your
convenience. Two of the orders were declined for guarantee by Signifyd
therefore are not eligible for reimbursement per our policy
<https://www.signifyd.com/resources/manual/signifyd-guarantee/reimbursement/>.

Thanks,
Tyler

subject: Thanks for connecting
description:
It sounds cold blooded but I was happy to hear you guys are interested in displacing Accertify and your in-house fraud team.

Let's keep that on ice for the moment since we're in the midst of buttoning up a huge long term contract that Accertify actually partnered with us on -I don't want to rock that boat.

I'll keep you posted in the near future.


Nick Key

Please disregard the bill submitted to your team. I'm working with our
Finance team to refund any payment acquired since your Cancellation

> prohibited.
>
> *From:* Michael P. Gallaher
> *Sent:* Thursday, June 14, 2018 11:24 AM
> *To:* All Employees <AllEmployees@ssfllp.com>
> *Subject:* SSF Athletic Division
>
>
>
> Hello Everyone,
>
>
>
> The sun had already set as the SSF softball team began warming up meaning
> that we had a late game. To those that made it out, thank you! We were able
> to field a full team and thankfully had the dynamic duo of awesome admins,
> Julie and Brittani from the San Jose office. As the “home” team we took the
> field first on defense and were ready to go. The first batter up from the
> other team cracked her first high in the sky just over Grant’s head at
> third flying foul in my direction. “I can catch this!” was my thought as I
> sprinted forward glove extended. As the ball and I converged on a single
> spot and our worlds collided, the ball passed the tip of my outstretched
> glove and blasted me on the foot. It hurt.
>
>
>
> The rest of the game went a little better. I believe it was the third
> inning when our lefty pitcher, Bob, blasted one down the right side with
> the bases loaded and getting to second base with 3 RBIs. Plays like those
> kept us competitive and besides the usual big hitters (they can’t hog all
> the highlights), Brittani had the best play that I’ve ever seen. Rounding
> second base she sprinted towards third as the ball was coming in to tag her
> out as there was no runner behind her. The ball came in high and the third
> baseman leapt in the air and snagged the ball as Brittani dropped to the
> ground, sliding in cleats first. Her foot touched the bag as the defender
> was still in the air. It was remarkable. In addition, Julie, who hasn’t
> played softball in a long time (if ever?) was getting batting tips from
> Greg Fyfe and Brittani before taking the plate. She was not intimidated and
> looked like a natural. He best whack at the ball was hit foul but it had
> some heat on it and almost took the heads off her fellow teammates.
> Hopefully she makes it to some more games!
>
>
>
> In the end, we lost by four but had a great time playing and gave it our
> best shot. A couple unfortunate errors and some great defense by the other
> team ultimately cost us the game. See the attached gif for a great shot of
> Brandon Scripps ripping out a deep ball! Also, we won’t have any more 9PM
> games thanks to our team’s expert general manager, me.
>
> Have a wonderful end to your week.
>
>
>
> Michael P. Gallaher

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Chargeback claim #515900198
description:
Additional To: slandry@sail.ca
CC: varbour@sail.ca; hsavard@sail.ca; ndens@sail.ca
BCC: 
Attachment: image005.jpg, image006.jpg

Subject: Re: Chargeback claim #515900198
Body:
Hi Stephanie,

According to our internal timeline: We approved the reimbursement claim on
June 8th. Our Chargeback team fought the chargeback on your behalf after
our review dictated that this appeared to be a case of friendly fraud,

Occasionally, when we review a chargeback that was submitted to us for
reimbursement, we conclude it may be a case of friendly fraud, where the
customer actually purchased and received the order but still filed a
chargeback with a fraud reason code.

In these situations, Signifyd may choose to challenge the chargeback on
your behalf, per our terms of service.

If the charge-back you’re requesting reimbursement for meets our
reimbursement criteria, and we choose to challenge the charge-back, the
following will happen:

   - You’ll still be reimbursed for the eligible chargeback per our
   standard timeline. We won’t hold back reimbursement on an eligible
   chargeback.
   - We may ask for more supporting documentation from you to build a
   stronger case.
   - We’ll submit a response to the charge-back and update you when we
   receive a result. (Should you be alerted of the result before us, you’ll
   need to notify us.)

If Signifyd is successful, as we were in this case, in disputing the
charge-back, the bank that issued the charge-back will return the funds
that were originally debited from the merchant’s account according to their
policies, called a Charge-back Reversal. Merchants will need to notify us
within seven (7) days of receiving it, and we will add this amount to their
monthly invoice in accordance with our billing policy, to recoup our
reimbursement.

I hope this addresses any confusion. Please let me know if there is any
other questions.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Luna Cycle | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: cmstskrt@icloud.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Luna Cycle | Signifyd
Body:
Hello,

I just wanted to follow up regarding your email earlier this morning
involving a declined order -- https://app.signifyd.com/cases/703215120

The rationale for the decline was:

   - The IP for the order was marked as an anonymous proxy
      - While the use of a proxy is not a direct indicator of fraudulent
      behavior, it can be a useful indicator when combined with other data
      elements to determine if an individual is attempting to hide their true
      identity
      - 1,200 mile distance between the IP and the billing address
   - Limited order history (Signifyd had not seen an order from the
   customer prior to 7/5/2018)

Feel free to review and let me know if there is any questions.

Best,
Ike

--

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: [EXTERNAL] Accertify Value Add
description:
Additional To: shaun.stewart@advance-auto.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: image001.png, ~WRD135.jpg, Signifyd One-Pager.pdf, Forrester Vendor Landscape.pdf

Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Accertify Value Add
Body:
Hi Shaun,

I hope you've been well over the last month. I took some time off for my
wedding, honeymoon, etc. so now I want to make sure I get you the general
info you were looking for.

Attached, you'll find a high level service/benefits overview that's mainly
focused on our chargeback liability shift (we pay your chargebacks) as well
as some other cost displacements like manual review overhead and false
positive declines.

Under the Select Partners, you'll see Accertify's Interceptas platform. To
answer your previous question though, it doesn't matter if you're not using
that particular product of theirs. We have an agnostic ability to connect
with any platform through our API. Here's
<http://go.toutapp.com/123c230ca7eedd4ec4> a quick read on our partnership
with them.

You might also find Forrester's Vendor Landscape interesting if you haven't
seen it already. The key takeaways at the top highlight the benefits our
Liability Shift model of protection. You can also find a number of
comparisons with Acceritfy in there.

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: Fraud Vendor Evaluation
description:
Additional To: sarah@uckele.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: image001.png

Subject: Re: Fraud Vendor Evaluation
Body:
- On your current version of Magento 2.1, our plugin integration can take
as little as one day's setup and testing. Note that if you eventually
upgrade to Magento 2.2, our service is natively built into that platform
and available at the flip of a switch. Magento partnered with Signifyd
<http://go.toutapp.com/0f11415353e90f3f41> as their sole partner for
versions 2.2 and higher since we are the market leader.

- Currently, I am approved to offer you 0.4% per approved transaction

-I'm happy to offer you a monthly contract

-Our standard terms ask for 30 days notice of termination -effectively
still a month-month contract

-We can certainly trial our decisions on a short term basis before going
live to ensure that we're producing the expected results

-We pioneered the Chargeback Guarantee and currently support the largest
range of fraudulent chargebacks. Our reimbursement policy also pays back
funds within 2 days of a submitted claim whereas Riskified only credits
your account for the following month. If cashflow is important to your
business, a rolling credit offered by Riskified could potentially leave you
uncredited and unpaid for extended periods. We pay you back almost
instantly.

Please let me know if I can provide further clarification or answers.
Thanks, Sarah.

subject: Unresolved Email: Incase | Reimbursement Claim for Order #200057482
description:
Additional To: cbottorf@incipio.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Incase | Reimbursement Claim for Order #200057482
Body:
Hi Cherise!

Thanks for reaching out and great to [virtually] meet you! By way of
introduction, my name is Warren Wong and I am the Client Services Manager
for the Incipio Group here at Signifyd. Mo from my Support team relayed
your request which I reviewed.

Based off the notes (and as you know), it seems the claim for order #200057482
(Signifyd Case #678726459) was submitted outside the 7-day window. Thanks
for partnering with us moving forward to ensure all submissions are within
7-days of receiving the chargeback.

If you decide to move forward with disputing the chargeback on your end,
please keep us informed of the final outcome. If the decision is ultimately
reversed and the funds are returned, please do let us know (since the
Signifyd reimbursement will have already been issued), so we can make note
of this on our end, and we'll apply a credit to your account which will be
used towards a future claim reimbursement.

That said, since we're aligned on the understanding that the above 7-day
timeline moving forward, we can make a one-time exception for the claim
towards order #200057482. *Can you please respond confirming this (so I can
inform my claims team to expect this submission)?*

Thanks so much,
Warren

Hey Alejandro,

I've attached a spreadsheet entailing your Overall Merchant Numbers and
list of transactions where we've reimbursed your store.

Signifyd has yet to receive a charge-back from Gear Coop in 2018 (Last CB
claim filed was in February 2017) and the overall Approval rate for the
store is 97.7% TXN AR.

Feel free to review the findings and let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Ike

Hi Anastasiya,

I hope you are doing well. I am not sure if you were aware, but we received
a notification yesterday that  Direct Liquidation has installed Riskified
and were able to confirm today. I'd love the opportunity to get on a call
and discuss whats driving this and what better understand what Signifyd can
do to ensure all merchants are receiving the best service.

Are you available to meet at one of the following times?

   - Friday 8/10: 10am - 1pm EST
   - Monday 8/13: 10am - 3pm EST
   - Wednesday 8/14: 10am - 1pm EST

Hope to hear from you soon.

Thanks,
Tyler

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: [Signifyd Support] - Cancelling our service
description:
Additional To: micah@bavsound.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: [Signifyd Support] - Cancelling our service
Body:
Hey Micah,

We're sad to see your team go but we are appreciative of your time with
Signifyd. Signifyd is still hoping to retain your store's services and
would love to get on a call to discuss further.

Are you able to get on a call to discuss your store's current rate and your
store's future plans for fraud protection?

In the meantime, I'll suspend the services so you will not be charged.

Please let me know if you have any questions at this time. I'll look
forward to your response.

Best,
Ike

Subject: Re: Signifyd Call Follow Up
Body:
Hi Kristina,

Thanks for reaching out.

The only webhook you'll need to configure is the Guarantee Completion
webhook using URL
*https://<magento-store-URL>/signifyd_connect/webhooks/index.*

Orders will automatically go on hold when sent to Signifyd and the
Guarantee Completion webhook will fire back to take approved orders
off-hold.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,
Matt

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: [Signifyd Support] - Magento 2 Integration Issues ref:_00Do0ZCct._5001Nf7dPJ:ref
description:
Additional To: jeff@trellis.co
CC: aj@trellis.co; francis@trellis.co
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: [Signifyd Support] - Magento 2 Integration Issues ref:_00Do0ZCct._5001Nf7dPJ:ref
Body:
Hi Jeff,

Thanks for sending that over. Before sending the updated version of the
extension, can you help me verify the following information?

1. Can you verify on your end if you're currently filtering orders with the
payment gate of *m2epropayment. *There was some communication between Jeff
at Affordable Vet and our Support team in late May referencing this topic.

To verify, the details can be found:


*On line 43 of file ../Observer/Purchase.phpAdd payment method which you
would like to be excluded to the list. Orders processed with these methods
are already being excluded from being processed by Signifyd.*

*protected $restrictedMethods = ['checkmo', 'banktransfer',
'purchaseorder', 'cashondelivery', 'm2epropayment']; *

2. Can you send me the order state from Magento for these failed
authorizations? Orders are sent to Signifyd when the following events
occur: checkout_submit_all_after and order_save.  Order states with the
following will be sent to Signifyd: new, payment_review, processing,
holded.
Thanks,
Matt

Body:
Hi AJ,

Thanks for the followup. I assume you were able to replicate the filter for
m2e on the newer extension?

Glad to hear the upgrade has resolved. Can you send over the error message
you're seeing as well?

Additionally, if you're able to send over the list of orders that resulted
in failed authorizations (either the order ID or case ID), I can work to
reconcile and cancel those orders to make things whole for the merchant.

Thanks,
Matt

On Fri, Aug 24, 2018 at 9:26 AM, AJ Tarachanowicz <aj@trellis.co> wrote:

> Hi Matt,
>
> On Aug 24, 2018, at 11:35 AM, Matt Ordway <matt.ordway@signifyd.com>
> wrote:
>
> Hi Jeff,
>
> Thanks for sending that over. Before sending the updated version of the
> extension, can you help me verify the following information?
>
> 1. Can you verify on your end if you're currently filtering orders with
> the payment gate of *m2epropayment. *There was some communication between
> Jeff at Affordable Vet and our Support team in late May referencing this
> topic.
>
> To verify, the details can be found:
>
>
> *On line 43 of file ../Observer/Purchase.phpAdd payment method which you
> would like to be excluded to the list. Orders processed with these methods
> are already being excluded from being processed by Signifyd.*
>
> *protected $restrictedMethods = ['checkmo', 'banktransfer',
> 'purchaseorder', 'cashondelivery', 'm2epropayment']; *
>
> After taking a look through the code I found an extension I wrote from
> back then that overrides that property and adds the m2epropayment as a
> restricted payment method. Yes, we’re filtering m2epropayment orders.
>
> 2. Can you send me the order state from Magento for these failed
> authorizations? Orders are sent to Signifyd when the following events
> occur: checkout_submit_all_after and order_save.  Order states with the
> following will be sent to Signifyd: new, payment_review, processing,
> holded.
>
> The order state is holded.
>
> FYI I’ve updated the Signifyd extension 2.4.0 and deployed it to
> production. I then submitted a test order and it was declined by
> Authorize.net and never sent to Signifyd for processing. I am receiving a
> generic error message stating someone thing went wrong and not the error
> message from Authorize.net. Fran or I will have to dig into code to see
> if that’s related to the Signifyd extension or something else but for now
> the clients main concern has been addressed.
>
> Thanks,
> Matt
>

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: In-Store Pickup Failures
description:
Additional To: nate@als.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: In-Store Pickup Failures
Body:
Due to the fact there is a level of fraud associated to in-store orders, we
will still screen those transactions. However the location will still be
positively reflected in the overall review/analysis of the order.

Hope this addresses your question. Feel free to let me know if you have any
other concerns.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Vintage King Audio | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: fraud@vintageking.com
CC: chargebacks@signifyd.com; jenifer@vintageking.com
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Vintage King Audio | Signifyd
Body:
Hello team,

About a month ago, we spoke to Jenifer who indicated that your team would
start the Chargeback Management phase by manually providing details
associated to the cases we were fighting on your behalf and work towards
providing Signifyd access to your payment portal. We were hoping to close
the loop on that ask and request access.

While you’re not required to share access to your portal for us to
represent you, by giving us access, we can automate the representment
process so you have fewer time-sensitive action items, and we will respond
to charge-backs more quickly and effectively.

Is this something that your team would be interested on trying out? Any
feedback would be greatly appreciated.

I'll look forward towards your response.

Best,
Ike

--

On Tue, Sep 4, 2018 at 8:46 AM Roger Emeka <roger.emeka@frankandoak.com>
wrote:

> Hi Ike,
>
> Hope you are well.
>
> I wanted to check in to see if there's anything specific to mention to you
> before we embark on the busy holiday period?
>
> Generally, average order values are definitely higher as customer spend
> more on gift etc.
>
> Also, virtual gift cards, which was a bit of an issue last year, are
> bought way more during this period as well.
>
> Finally, we may also be launching a new twist to our Style Plan membership
> where customers are only billed based on what they return
>
> (I.E. Customers orders 5 items and they are only initially charged a
> nominal fee ($25). Once they receive the items, they have 2-3 days to send
> back anything they don't want. Say out of those 5 items, they return back
> 1. Once we process the return for that 1 item, we would bill them for 4
> items. Basically, our returns team becomes our biller). Would that change
> anything within our systems?
>
> Please let me know if there's a meeting we should book, or if there's any
> more information you may need from us.
>
> Thanks
>

Body:
Hey Moose,

Unfortunately, we're unable to make further exceptions for your account.
We've previously made exceptions in the past involving claims submitted by
your store outside our 7-day window.

We're hopeful that we can continue work with you to resolve any further
delays in getting your claims processed in the future. In the meantime if
you have any other questions please let me know.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: I: increasing approval rate
description:
Additional To: riccardo.capuzzo@digitalboite.com
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: I: increasing approval rate
Body:
Hey Riccardo,

I've flagged this again with our Risk team as I previously thought we've
addressed this concern. I'm attempting to require that our rules are
softened for returning customers. Please note that while returning
customers do have a higher chance at approval, it does not necessarily
'guarantee' an approval for every returning transaction.

In the meantime if you see any transactions which you feel are incorrectly
declined please resubmit the order for approval or flag those transactions
to me directly.

Let's get on a call early next week to discuss this further as well as the
reformatting of your storefronts. I'll bring in Fahid for assistance during
the call as well.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: VPO.CA Order 153823
description:
Additional To: cs@vpo.ca
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Re: VPO.CA Order 153823
Body:
Hi Kira,

When we examine both transactions there were aspects of the recent
transaction that caused our Fraud analysts some pause:

   1. AVS Failure (Billing Address deemed unreliable)
   2. IP address and Billing address mismatch
   3. Large distance between IP and Billing address (900+ miles)
   4. Inability to tie the Card holder to the address provided
   5. Different BIN number for the 2nd order

For these reasons we chose to decline the order. I hoped this helped in
clarifying any confusion.

Feel free to let me know if you'd like any action to be made on this order.

Thanks,
Ike

Hi Abby,

Just wanted to follow up with you regarding your recent request to cancel
your account with Signifyd. I'll certainly process that request if that is
still your preferred end result.

I'd love to understand what caused this decision so we can correct these

subject: Unresolved Email: Re: ABYSS BY ABBY PTY LTD | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: sales@abyssclothing.com.au
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: image001.jpg, image002.png

Subject: Re: ABYSS BY ABBY PTY LTD | Signifyd
Body:
Hello,

I definitely understand your frustration. This is part of the reason why
I'd like to insert myself into the conversation and go over each of the
claims declined:

*Cristal Armenta* (Order #31050) was declined due to the claim being filed
past our 7-day policy. For charge-back notices received via regular mail,
we ask that you provide the envelope showing the date received, however, if
the envelope does not show the date received, we ask that you date stamp
the charge-back notice before providing it to our claims team. If you do
not provide the envelope the charge-back notice was sent in or stamp the
notice with the date received, our claims team will go by the date listed
on the notice because they would then have no other date to reference.
Signifyd has put this policy into effect to help prevent future fraud.
We're hopeful that you can coordinate with your payment processor on
electronic notifications. For the meantime, date stamping a document upon
arrival at your office would alleviate most concerns.

*Brenda Starling* (Order #32867) was declined due to re-routing. Signifyd
does not allow re-routing of the delivery address due to the fact the
guarantee liability coverage is tied to the delivery address. To overcome
this we'd recommend disabling the ability to change the address OR to
communicate address changes with Signifyd prior to delivery.

We're open to revisiting Order #31050. We will be able to reimburse the
claim amount once you respond via email that you acknowledge this as a
one-time exception and will adhere to our policy guidelines going forward.
Once I receive your written acknowledgement, our Claims team will reimburse
your charge-back claim.

If there were any areas in need of further examination let's hop on a call
to discuss further. Feel free to review and provide me with your thoughts
at your earliest convenience.

Best,
Ike

subject: Unresolved Email: Sportium/SAIL | Signifyd
description:
Additional To: varbour@sail.ca; ndens@sail.ca; slandry@sail.ca
CC: 
BCC: 
Attachment: 

Subject: Sportium/SAIL | Signifyd
Body:
Hi Valerie,

I was hoping to follow up with you regarding a recent claim you've filed.
This claim was initially declined is due to reason code of the Chargeback
not being either Fraud or Unauthorized Charge.

After reviewing this transaction with our Head of Chargeback Management, we
would like to give your store a free, one-time use of our Chargeback
Management service where Signifyd fights the chargeback on your behalf.

This transaction appears to be a case of Friendly Fraud:

*A form of chargeback abuse, where the customer actually purchased and
received the order, but chose to file a chargeback dishonestly by claiming,
for example, they never authorized the purchase or didn’t receive the
order. *

*It’s a particularly difficult type of fraud to preemptively detect,
because the purchase is actually a legitimate purchase made by the
authorized cardholder.*

Ultimately, challenging friendly fraud chargebacks protects your brand and
your reputation with both your processor and the banks involved. It also
discourages dishonest buyers from further targeting your store and abusing
the chargeback process.

With the time-sensitivity associated to this dispute (10/26 respond date)
we would need access to your payment portal to facilitate this as soon as
possible. Feel free to review and alert me at your earliest convenience.

Best,
Ike

--
